tr.td:
Dear Dr. O'Reilly
I had the pleasure of meeting Ms. Walker at the palliative care outpatient clinic today, referred by Susan Snodgrass from the community Macmillan team, Endowdown Centre, BM5 0TP on the 23 April 2017.

td.p: Organisation: Community Macmillan team, Endowdown Centre, BM5 0TP

tr.td: 3. Necrotic subcutaneous soft tissue nodule (anterior to liver)

display.value: Necrotic subcutaneous soft tissue nodule (anterior to liver)

tr.td: Ms. Walker was referred for review of symptom control. She has been on pazopanib since May 2017.She had a right nephrectomy for clear cell renal carcinoma in Sept 2016, and now has metastatic disease.

tr.th: History of each presenting complaint or issue

tr.td: Ms. Walker struggles with pain predominantly around the right upper quadrant of her abdomen and this goes all the way round to the back, at worst described as 10/10. She has been reluctant to take full dose of Co codamol - she intermittently takes one tablet at a time (30/500mg). According to Karen, Ms. Walker clearly has a high pain tolerance level and tends to underplay her symptoms.
Ms. Walker finds herself tiring out by the second half of the day, particularly if she has done a bit more than usual earlier on.

According to Karen, she and Ms. Walker have been intermittently tearful and upset given news of disease recurrence and are doing their best to deal with it. Ms. Walker wasn't expecting to hear about cancer recurrence in such a short period after her surgery.
Ms. Walker has no known allergies or adverse reactions.
Musculoskeletal system - Trapezius discomfort on elevation of the shoulders. Discomfort on active neck movements.

title.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

display.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

tr.th: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes
tr.td: I just want to stop hurting all the time and to have some energy back.
To be taken one hour before bed
A link to the record which contains the Indication for this medication order.
Titrating upwards according to response and tolerance.
Patient given 2x week prescription in clinic. GP to please review in 2xweeks and renew or amend prescription as necessary.

tr.th: Actions for patient or their carer
tr.td: Should endeavor to take regular, gentle exercise in gradually increasing amounts.
The patient was advised that previous abnormal blood results are not of any clinical significant other than reflecting known diagnosis of thyroid disease.

text.value: To be taken one hour before bed.
Fatigue. No evidence of inflammatory arthritis.
